title: 14-year-old dies after shooting self during standoff
content:
BOISE -- The Ada County Coroner's Office confirmed Monday that a Boise boy who shot himself during a standoff with law enforcement has died.
Christian Alexander Page, 14, died at Saint Alphonsus Regional Medical Center Saturday morning.
Page, a suspect in a July arson that destroyed a pair of storage units, refused to come out of a friend's home on Kerf Street Friday afternoon, prompting a standoff with Kuna Police. According to the Ada County Sheriff's Office, the boy had taken two guns from a family member and left home earlier in the week.
MORE: Sheriff's office: Teen shoots himself during standoff
Crisis negotiators were called out to the scene to speak with Page, but he shot himself during the hours-long standoff, authorities say.
Page was taken to the hospital with life-threatening injuries, and was pronounced dead at 7:05 a.m. Saturday.
The 14-year-old's cause and manner of death are listed as "pending." Coroner Dotti Owens said a post-mortem examination will happen after a donation process is complete.
The Kuna School District said in a post on Facebook that counselors would be made available at Kuna Middle School and Kuna High School.
